keyMoments.title: Gear Second Full Combat Debut
keyMoments.description: Luffy activates Gear Second in full combat against Blueno, with steam rising from his body as he declares all his attacks have gone up a level. This is the first time viewers see Gear Second used extensively in battle.
keyMoments.significance: Marks Luffy's most significant power evolution to date, proving he can match CP9's elite agents and showing his growth since the Aokiji defeat.
keyMoments.quote: All of my attacks have gone up a step. You won't be able to keep up with me anymore!

keyMoments.title: Gomu Gomu no Jet Pistol
keyMoments.description: Luffy unleashes his first Gear Second attack, Jet Pistol, moving at such high speed that Blueno can barely see the attack coming before being sent flying into a wall.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of how Gear Second amplifies Luffy's techniques with enhanced speed and power.

keyMoments.title: Jet Bazooka Defeats Blueno
keyMoments.description: Luffy finishes Blueno with Gomu Gomu no Jet Bazooka, breaking through his strongest Tekkai defense and leaving a massive dent in his chest.
keyMoments.significance: Decisive victory over a CP9 agent, proving Gear Second's effectiveness and establishing Luffy as ready for stronger opponents.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Shouts to Robin
keyMoments.description: After defeating Blueno, Luffy yells Robin's name from the courthouse roof, his voice echoing across Enies Lobby to reassure her that he's coming to save her.
keyMoments.significance: Emotional moment reinforcing the episode's theme of protecting friends and giving Robin hope.

abilities.description: Luffy pumps his blood at an accelerated rate, enhancing his speed, strength, and mobility. Steam rises from his body due to the extreme metabolic heat, and his skin turns shiny and pink.
A Gear Second-enhanced version of Gomu Gomu no Pistol, delivering a massively faster and more powerful punch.
A Gear Second-enhanced rapid-fire punch attack with increased speed and power.
A Gear Second-enhanced aerial kick attack delivering devastating impact.
A Gear Second-enhanced piercing attack using extended legs.
A Gear Second-enhanced version where Luffy twists his body and launches himself at the opponent.
A Gear Second-enhanced version of Bazooka, Luffy's signature two-fisted attack. Strong enough to break through Tekkai 'Go' and defeat Blueno.

reveals.information: Gear Second can be used in sustained combat, significantly enhancing all of Luffy's attacks
Gear Second puts significant strain on Luffy's body, which he acknowledges isn't fully adapted to handle it yet

keyMoments.title: Tekkai 'Go' Defense
keyMoments.description: Blueno activates Tekkai 'Go', his strongest variation of the Iron Body technique, in an attempt to withstand Luffy's Gear Second barrage.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Blueno's ultimate defensive technique, though it proves insufficient against Gear Second.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Jet Bazooka
keyMoments.description: Blueno is decisively defeated by Luffy's Jet Bazooka, which breaks through his Tekkai defense and leaves him unconscious with a massive chest injury.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the power gap between Gear Second Luffy and standard CP9 agents.

abilities.description: Blueno's strongest variation of Tekkai (Iron Body), hardening his body to an extreme degree to withstand powerful attacks. However, it proves insufficient against Gear Second's power.

reveals.information: Blueno's Tekkai 'Go' is his strongest defensive technique but can be broken by sufficiently powerful attacks
Blueno is completely outclassed by Gear Second Luffy, unable to keep up with the enhanced speed

keyMoments.title: Enbima Yonezu Oni Giri
keyMoments.description: Zoro uses Enbima Yonezu Oni Giri, a powerful variation of Oni Giri where the swords are twisted during the slash, to clear multiple Marines simultaneously.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's continued development of Three Sword Style variations.

abilities.description: A stronger variation of Oni Giri where the swords are twisted during the slash for added force, striking multiple opponents instead of one. The name can also be read as 'shrimp mayonnaise rice ball' in Japanese.

keyMoments.title: Three-Headed Judge Appears
keyMoments.description: Baskerville, the Three-Headed Judge and Chief Justice of Enies Lobby, attempts to stop the Straw Hats by declaring they've entered a place of sacred judgment.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the courthouse's chief authority figure as an obstacle.
keyMoments.quote: You have entered a place of sacred judgment!

keyMoments.title: Confronted by Franky Family
keyMoments.description: The Franky Family grabs Baskerville and pulls him down, telling the Straw Hats they'll handle the judge so the crew can continue advancing.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the alliance between the Straw Hats and Franky Family.

reveals.information: Baskerville is actually three men (Bas, And, and Kerville) who are such close friends they act as one body

keyMoments.title: Spandam's Growing Panic
keyMoments.description: Spandam receives reports of the Straw Hats' advance and Blueno's defeat, causing his confidence to crack as he realizes the pirates are far more capable than anticipated.
keyMoments.significance: Character development showing Spandam's cowardice and lack of combat ability.
